verses.roman:
viṣṇu-kāñcī āsi' dekhila lakṣmī-nārāyaṇa
praṇāma kariyā kaila bahuta stavana

synonyms: viṣṇu-kāñcī—to the holy place named Viṣṇu-kāñcī; āsi'-coming; dekhila—the Lord saw; lakṣmī-nārāyaṇa—the Deity of Lord Nārāyaṇa with mother Lakṣmī, the goddess of fortune; praṇāma kariyā—after offering obeisances; kaila—made; bahuta stavana—many prayers.
translation: The Lord then visited a holy place known as Viṣṇu-kāñcī. There He saw Lakṣmī-Nārāyaṇa Deities, and He offered His respects and many prayers to please Them.

purport.content: Viṣṇu-kāñcī is situated about five miles away from Kañjīvaramā. It is here that Lord Varadarāja, another form of Lord Viṣṇu, resides. There is also a big lake known as Ananta-sarovara.
